image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The man's mother has also been charged, with a hearing in the Adelaide Magistrates Court told the alleged offence was not related to the police officer's death last November.

title.children: Alleged shooter of SA police officer Jason Doig faces unrelated firearm charges, court hears

image.altText: An SA Ambulance Service sign on the side of a vehicle with another in the background saying Emergency Ambulance

props.synopsis: Police will prepare a report for the coroner after CPR failed to resuscitate the man.

title.children: Man dies after he was pulled unconscious from ocean in Adelaide's south

image.altText: Close up photo of Derek Bromley as a middle-aged man, wearing blue cap and blue shirt, smiling.

props.synopsis: In 1984 Derek Bromley was convicted of murdering Adelaide man Stephen Docoza, a crime Bromley has always denied committing. This month brings fresh hope to him and his advocates.

title.children: During the day Derek uses his firefighting experience to help his community. At night, he returns to his prison cell

image.altText: Woman holding and looking at a glass of water in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: In a regional town just a few hours from Adelaide, an ongoing water crisis means the locals and their animals won't drink the tap water — yet residents are paying the same rates as residents in the city.

title.children: 'It destroys everything': The Australian town with undrinkable, salty and corrosive tap water

image.altText: A child hands a bottle of baby formula milk to a two-year-old.

props.synopsis: It's the ultra-processed milk powder intentionally marketed as a follow-on to breastfeeding or infant formulae. But the evidence suggests toddler or transition milks are unnecessary at best and harmful at worst.

title.children: 'Hoodwinked and fooled': How Australian parents are being misled on toddler milk

image.altText: An image of an outdoor mall.

props.synopsis: A staff member at a sports store in Adelaide's Rundle Mall is taken to hospital and the shop is temporarily closed after an alleged assault by a teenager.

title.children: Teen to face court over alleged assault of worker in Adelaide sports store

image.altText: An aerial shot of a mass of reddish-brown water in an outback landscape.

props.synopsis: Police have "urgent welfare concerns" for three elderly people and four children who are missing in WA's flooded outback.

title.children: 'Too dangerous': Search postponed for seven people, including four children, lost in WA floods

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo

props.synopsis: A pair charged over an alleged kidnapping and assault of a man in Melbourne last month have been named as Laura Allam and Mohammad Sharab after a suppression order was partially lifted.

title.children: Human rights activist charged over alleged kidnapping and assault of a man in Melbourne

image.altText: pig

props.synopsis: Politicians who stayed for the footage from a Stanhope piggery, including the alleged bestiality of a pig by a worker, watched on in shock today as it was played to them at the parliamentary Inquiry into Pig Welfare in Victoria.

title.children: MPs at inquiry refuse to watch footage of Victorian piggery, including vision of alleged bestiality

image.altText: Figs split open displaying their juicy flesh

props.synopsis: A South Australian farmer wants to see more of the thousands of fig varieties become more widely available to consumers.

title.children: Fruit collector's favourite time of year arrives as obscure figs come into season

image.altText: A woman in a dress with African print and a headress holds her arms aloft

props.synopsis: After a worryingly busy 2023 event, and in the midst of controversy, WOMADelaide still shines thanks to its artists and their stories.

title.children: How two Rwandan farmers became the hit of WOMADelaide 2024

image.altText: MCU of former Boeing Quality Manager John Barnett sitting in his house wearing a white open collared shirt and grey jacket

props.synopsis: Former Boeing worker John Barnett, who warned of production defects that were ignored by the company, dies in the United States.

title.children: Boeing whistleblower John Barnett found dead in US

image.altText: A composite image of Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam and Sydney Roosters' Spencer Leniu during their NRL season opener in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: While much of rugby league world spent the last week squabbling over whether Spencer Leniu calling Ezra Mam a "monkey" was a racist slur or just banter, there was a collective eye roll from many First Nations people.

title.children: Why Spencer Leniu's 'monkey' slur was more than 'one brown man sledging another brown man'

image.altText: A close up of two inconsistences in a photo

props.synopsis: The stakes of a Princess Catherine photo could not have been higher amid a swirl of speculation. But instead of avoiding a media storm, the House of Windsor is now caught up in a hurricane of coverage, with no certainty about when it will blow over, writes Rebecca Armitage and Lucia Stein.

title.children: Kate and William made two choices that turned their PR nightmare into an unmitigated disaster

image.altText: A man is seen bleeding from his head while emergency services are on board

props.synopsis: Authorities seize the flight data recorders for Chilean LATAM Airlines Flight 800 after a "technical fault" caused passengers to be "thrown out of their seats" while it was flying from Sydney to Auckland.

title.children: 'Mass chaos broke out': The moments after the LATAM Airlines flight to NZ suddenly lost altitude

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A Moree police officer playing goaltender at the PCYC hall

props.synopsis: The laws will be in place for 12 months, and will make it tougher for young people to get bail for offences like stealing a car or breaking into a house in NSW.

title.children: Critics warn against 'dangerous' youth crime crackdown in NSW that threatens to increase incarceration

image.altText: Golden coins with the Bitcoin logo on it are pictured.

props.synopsis: Bitcoin is currently hovering around record highs as the UK financial regulators allows professional investors to use crypto exchange-traded notes.

title.children: Views on bitcoin 'range from evangelist to atheist', but there's no denying its popularity

image.altText: A generic image of a carer crouching down and pointing next to a man who is using a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Three years after a bruising royal commission exposed substandard care leading to neglect and abuse in nursing homes, elderly Australians may be asked to fork out more money than ever before, writes Anne Connolly.

title.children: Baby boomers may be asked to fork out more than ever under controversial aged care reforms

props.synopsis: The government is considering charging more for aged care. How much do care recipients pay today?

title.children: Aged care fees could be changing. Who pays what now?

image.altText: Politicians Bob Katter and Ross Cadell confront each other.

props.synopsis: The Queensland MP warned Senator Cadell to stop playing politics and spend his time "attacking" Woolworths and Coles instead.

title.children: Bob Katter tells Senator Ross Cadell to 'shut up' in fiery exchange at supermarket pricing inquiry hearings

image.altText: A man in a blue suit holds an envelope in his left hand.

props.synopsis: Al Pacino and an Oscars producer address the confusion caused by the Godfather star reading out the Best Picture winner but not mentioning any of the other nominees.

title.children: Oscars producer apologises for Best Picture slip-up and Kimmel reveals he was told not to mention Trump

image.altText: The NSW Treasurer Daniel Mookhey in a suit wearing glasses

props.synopsis: The NSW government says the state is being robbed of money to bail out other states, making it "virtually impossible" to return a predicted budget surplus this financial year.

title.children: Service delivery at risk as lowest GST revenue delivered to NSW in 20 years, Mookhey says

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a white shirt

props.synopsis: The body of 58-year-old Colleen South was found in a paddock in north-west Victoria in 2022. The Coroner's Court has heard a farmer's call to nearby police went to the answering machine as the station was unstaffed.

title.children: 'Missed opportunities' by Victoria Police in search for woman led to possible fatal delays, coroner hears

image.altText: Four rainbow lorikeets in little towel beds being nursed.

props.synopsis: The ailment, known as lorikeet paralysis syndrome, spread rapidly through south-east Queensland rainbow lorikeet populations earlier this year.

title.children: Rainbow lorikeets released after recovering from paralysis syndrome that causes them to fall from the sky

image.altText: Close up of Andrew Tate wearing a tweed blazer

props.synopsis: Internet personality Andrew Tate has been detained in Romania and handed an arrest warrant issued by British authorities, his spokesperson said.

title.children: Online influencer Andrew Tate detained in Romania, handed UK arrest warrant, his spokesperson says

image.altText: Eric Cramen

props.synopsis: American singer and Raspberries frontman Eric Carmen, who was best known for hits such as All By Myself and Hungry Eyes, has died aged 74.

title.children: Hungry Eyes singer Eric Carmen dies aged 74

image.altText: A silouette of a man holding a gun with a question mark around his head

props.synopsis: For years, Hamas' Marwan Issa evaded the public eye, becoming one of Israel's "most wanted" men. Now, Israel says it is "assessing" an air strike against him. Here's what we know.

title.children: Israel says it's 'assessing' air strike on Hamas' 'shadow man' and deputy military commander. But who is Marwan Issa?

image.altText: two men inside a gym

props.synopsis: The former Comanchero has been sentenced to more than three years behind bars for hindering the investigation into the death of Youssef Assoum.

title.children: Former Comanchero Tarek Zahed sentenced for hindering homicide investigation

image.altText: A composite of the Airbnb logo and a security camera.

props.synopsis: Airbnb hosts have until next month to comply with the online rental platform's new ban on the use of indoor security cameras in its listings around the world.

title.children: Airbnb bans the use of indoor security cameras from its listings worldwide

image.altText: Narendra Modi looks directly into camera while wearing rimless glasses and a beige stole

props.synopsis: One of the most powerful people in the world, Narendra Modi is running for a rare third term as India's prime minister. But much of his life has been shrouded in mystery. These hidden chapters tell the true story.

title.children: Modi spruiks himself as a single man, but in a humble home in rural India lives his secret wife

image.altText: A close-up of Ariel Henry in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Haitian Prime Minister Ariel Henry tenders his resignation after a drastic escalation of violence in the capital Port-au-Prince during his absence left him stranded in Puerto Rico.

title.children: Haitian Prime Minister Ariel Henry says he will resign amid gang violence

image.altText: A 31-year-old American man accused of murder, center, is led into the courtroom at the regional court in Kempten, Germany.

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old's actions were described as "incredibly callous" during the sentencing hearing.

title.children: US man will spend life in prison for murder and rape attack on two women in Germany

image.altText: a young man drinking a beer at the pub

props.synopsis: A Redbank Plains man has faced court charged with the murder of 21-year-old Will Swinbourne following an extensive manhunt on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Man allegedly stabbed to death with kitchen knife in Gold Coast car park during drug deal gone wrong, police say

image.altText: A tired-looking Tennis star Novak Djokovic sits with eyes closed as he holds a towel to his face during a match.

props.synopsis: Little-known Italian Luca Nardi takes advantage of his second chance at Indian Wells, as the 'lucky loser' knocks Novak Djokovic out of the tournament in one of the sporting shocks of the year.

title.children: Novak Djokovic rues 'bad day' after shock exit at Indian Wells

image.altText: Two men stand outside in farming paddock, one wears a cap and another a hat.

props.synopsis: For one of the most successful footballers of the modern era, farming provides the perfect relief to the high-pressured environment of elite sport.

title.children: How AFL superstar Tom Hawkins balances family, farming and football
